name: neigh
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a long, loud, high call that is produced by a horse when it is excited or frightened

If a horse neighs, it makes a long, loud, high call of excitement or fear: When he laughs he sounds like a horse neighing. The white horse neighed softly and jogged off.
More examplesFewer examplesThe moment he lays his hand upon the stable door, the pony neighs.She neighed again, and all the animals broke into a gallop.Rosie the horse was saved after her week-old foal neighed to attract passers-by.
